00012 
00016 // An sc_earth_elevation_square represents one of the tiled DEM (Digital Elevation Model) files used
00017 // to map lat/lon to elevations. We currently use DEM files from the GTOPO30 data set obtained
00018 // via download from the US Geological Service Earth Resources Observation & Sciencer (EROS)
00019 // Center. The files were current as of 02/16/2010. At that date, the web location was:
00020 // http://eros.usgs.gov/#/Find_Data/Products_and_Data_Available/gtopo30_info
00021 //
00022 // The DEM files represent a grid of 3 rows of 9 tiles covering 40 degress of longitude
00023 // and 50 degrees of latitude each for everything above -60 deg latitude, and 1 row of 6 tiles
00024 // covering 60 degrees of longitude and 30 degrees of latitude for everything south of -60 deg
00025 // latitude. Each of the 27 tiles has 6000 rows and 4800 columns of 16 bit integers in big-ending
00026 // byte-order. They are in row-major order, so the first 12000 bytes represent the first row.
00027 // Each of the 6 tiles covering the southern portion of the globe has 3600 rows and 7200 columns.
00028 // Longitudes increase as you move across each row of data, and latitudes decrease as you move
00029 // down each column of data. Each "pixel" of data represents approximately 0.0083333333333
00030 // degrees of latitude/longitude. Values in the tables are in METERS, but values returned by
00031 // sc_earth_elevation are converted to KILOMETERS.
00032 //
00033 // If using compressed DEM files, we break the files into strips of 1200 rows (10 degrees)
00034 // and use zlib compression on them.
00035 //
00036 
00037 #ifndef __SC_EARTH_ELEVATION__
00038 #define __SC_EARTH_ELEVATION__
00039

00044 #endif

00047 
00049 #define kDegreesPerPixel 0.0083333333333
00050 
00052 typedef enum
00053 {
00054     elev_precision_none = 0,
00055     elev_precision_10  = 1,  // 10 deg x 10 deg
00056     elev_precision_1   = 2,  // 1 deg x 1 deg
00057     elev_precision_01  = 3,  // .1 deg x .1 deg
00058     elev_precision_001 = 4   // .01 deg x .01 deg
00059 }
00060 ElevationPrecision;
